steamServicesIssues: Steam services are currently experiencing issues
noOutagesDetected: No outages detected in the last hour
checkForUpdatesDesc: Automatically check for new plugin versions
enableNotificationsDesc: Show notifications when Steam services go down or recover
enableNotificationAntifloodDesc: Limit notifications to 10 per 3 minutes to prevent spam
aboutSteamStatusDesc: Steam Status displays real-time information about Steam services, helping you know when Steam is experiencing issues. Data is fetched from a gateway server that monitors Steam's services.
playersOnlineDesc: Total users currently logged into Steam
webapiDesc: Steam Web API for third-party integrations
historySparklineDesc: A mini graph showing player count trends over the last hour. Helps visualize if Steam is experiencing unusual activity.
connectionManagersStatusDesc: Shows status of Steam Connection Manager servers across 27 regions worldwide. Each region displays its flag, status, and server count. Useful for checking if issues are region-specific.
outageNotificationsDesc: Automatic notifications when Steam services go down. You'll get a one-time alert when an outage is detected, and another when services are restored.
offlineModeDesc: When the gateway is unreachable, the plugin displays the last known status. Look for "(Cached)" indicator to know you're viewing offline data.
trendingGamesFeatureDesc: Shows the top 5 Steam Deck verified/playable games with the biggest player count gains in the last 24 hours. Click on any game to open its Steam store page directly.
autoUpdateFeatureDesc: The plugin automatically checks for new versions on GitHub. When an update is available, you'll see the latest version in the About section with an "Update" button to install it directly from the plugin.
networkDiagnosticsFeatureDesc: Local network testing tools to help diagnose connection issues. These tests run from your Steam Deck to check your internet connection and Steam server connectivity.
steamLatencyTestDesc: Measures your connection latency to Steam's Connection Manager servers. The test fetches the official CM server list from Steam and tests a sample of 10 servers to find your best connection. Lower latency means better responsiveness for Steam features.
internetSpeedTestDesc: Tests your download speed by downloading a 100MB file from a reliable server. This helps identify if slow performance is caused by your internet connection. Upload speed is estimated at 40% of download speed.
settingsRefreshIntervalDesc: Controls how often the plugin automatically fetches new data from the gateway server. Set to 'Off' to disable automatic updates and only refresh manually.
settingsShowHistoryDesc: Displays a sparkline graph showing player count trends over the last 24 hours below the current player count.
settingsShowTrendingGamesDesc: Shows the top 5 Steam Deck verified/playable games with the biggest player count gains in the last 48 hours.
settingsCheckForUpdatesDesc: Automatically checks GitHub for new plugin versions on startup. When enabled, you'll see an 'Update' button in the About section when a new version is available.
settingsEnableNotificationsDesc: Shows Steam Deck notifications when Steam services go down or recover. You'll get one notification when an outage is confirmed and another when services are restored.
settingsEnableNotificationAntifloodDesc: Limits notifications to 10 per 3 minutes to prevent spam during gateway or API issues. This protection runs locally on your Steam Deck and only affects this plugin's notifications.
